content:
# I have successfully gathered 10 coal, bringing my inventory to include 10 Coal, 10 Copper Ore, 6 Stone, and 3 Iron Gear Wheels.

# However, the Stone Furnace is currently showing a status of "NO_INGREDIENTS," which means it doesn't have any Copper Ore to smelt. This is likely because I had previously inserted Copper Ore into the furnace, but it has not been processed due to the lack of coal.

# I will now proceed to insert 2 coal into the Stone Furnace to fuel it and then insert the 10 Copper Ore to start the smelting process again.

insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=2)  # Insert 2 coal into the Stone Furnace
insert_item(Prototype.CopperOre, furnace, quantity=10)  # Insert the 10 Copper Ore into the Stone Furnace

# After inserting, I will wait for the smelting process to complete and check the outputs periodically.
for _ in range(20):  # Wait for a maximum of 10 seconds (checking every 0.5 seconds)
    sleep(0.5)  # Wait for the smelting process
    furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace)
    if furnace_inventory.get(Prototype.CopperPlate, 0) >= 5:  # Check if at least 5 Copper Plates have been produced
        break

# Check the status of the furnace and overall inventory
print(f"Furnace inventory after waiting: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")  # Check furnace output
print(f"Inventory after copper smelting: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check overall inventory after smelting
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Check entities on the map again
